intro: Chaetanthera multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
